oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Frederick M. Williamson to Alice O. McBee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter from Frederick M. Williamson to Alice O. McBee. Williamson wrote from General Hospital No. 2, 3rd Division Ward in Lynchburg, Va. He describes his illness and only having a blanket and a bed of straw to rest on. He discusses wanting to return home to Texas and that he has received several letters from family and friends since being in the hospital. He also mentions wanting to get married once he returns home.
